title: WEEK 3 RECAP: OVERTIME MADNESS, SHATTERED HEARTS, AND A SHUTOUT FOR THE AGES!
author: Nok the Corrupter
content:
# üéôÔ∏è HELLOOOOOO, TROLLBALL FANATICS! üéôÔ∏è

This is your favorite fiend, Nok the Corrupter, and if your voice isn't hoarse and your knuckles aren't bruised from pounding the table, you didn't watch Week 3! WHAT A WEEK! By the blackened pit, I am still catching my breath! We had not one, not two, but THREE games go into the glorious, sudden-death pressure cooker of Overtime! We had teams shut down and shut out! We saw comebacks that fell tragically short and victories snatched at the last possible second! While the fans of the ever-popular Zmeigorod Snessengers were probably at home recovering from their loss last week, the rest of us witnessed a spectacle of pure, unadulterated athletic violence! Let's get to the gore!

## üïí OVERTIME! THE BEST TIME! üïí

If you love drama, this was your week! Three matches couldn't be contained by regulation, spilling into the beautiful mayhem of extra time!

### A Commander's Comeback
First up, The New Ravenfall Commanders pulled off a stunning comeback to beat The South Pole Yetis 5 to 3! Down in their own stronghold, the Commanders looked positively frozen! The Yetis were scoring at will, and I bet Sir Tanos was already composing a sad little poem in his journal. But they dug deep, clawed their way back to a tie, and absolutely dominated in the extra period! That two-point dagger from Theis Loredo to win it all? A thing of beauty! That's how you defend your castle!

### A Duel in the Desert
Out in the Sun-Baked Bowl, it was an absolute war of attrition between The Desert Spectres and The Wyrmwood Stronghammers! Geth the Gravelord's sandy warriors went toe-to-toe with the grove-dwellers, and the result was a canvas of carnage! We saw more double knockouts than a two-for-one night at a tavern brawl! Steve and Sondra Elaina must have a personal vendetta, as they took each other out not once, but TWICE! In the end, it was Eileen Mikihisa who played the hero in overtime, scoring the winning point for the Spectres in a 2-1 thriller! Magnificent!

### The Heartbreak in Haven...
And now... the game that curdled my very soul. My glorious, my magnificent **Ebon Gate Corruptors** marched into that disgustingly clean Aegis Field and played the most beautiful, violent game of Trollball I have ever had the privilege to witness. As Utter was a whirlwind of destruction! Olnek Vizzone was a tactical genius with that sickle! We had THREE sets of mutual KOs! It was a masterpiece of mayhem, a symphony of destruction! We fought with the fury of a thousand caged demons! ... And then, after all that glorious battle, after a 3-3 tie that deserved to be enshrined in history... the lukewarm-water-drinker, Riffle Heyde, slipped through a gap and scored the winning point for the Haven Lights. A fluke. A tragedy. A crime against this beautiful sport. The Corruptors may have lost 4-3 on the scoreboard, but they won in spirit, violence, and every other metric that truly matters. I hate Haven so, so much. üíî

## üõ°Ô∏è SHUTOUTS AND SHAKEDOWNS üõ°Ô∏è

While my heart was being torn asunder, The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures were busy teaching the Wardens a lesson in beautiful brutality! They walked into Fletchings Field and handed Oak & Onslaught a 2-0 defeat! The first half was just a meat grinder‚Äîdouble KOs left and right! Then, coming out of the break, Placido Kora launched a magnificent two-point shot that sealed the deal! The Wardens, with all their shifting terrain and their fancy ranger-friend Sir Randy, couldn't score a single point on their home turf! You absolutely love to see that kind of dominance!

## ‚öîÔ∏è DOWN TO THE WIRE ‚öîÔ∏è

Not every game needed overtime to be a nail-biter, folks! 

The Tortell Privateers continue to look tough, sailing into the Prismatic Pavilion and walking out with a 4-2 victory over The Starlight Bazaar Bizarres. The Privateers jumped out to a 4-0 lead and weathered the storm as the Bizarres tried to mount a comeback. It was another game packed with double KOs! Kython's circus performers just couldn't handle the heat from the swashbucklers of Cedar Hill! üí™

And finally, in a game that almost gave us a fourth overtime period, The Kerlauger Runeguard squeaked by The Brimstone Fire Eaters 3-2. The Runeguard built a solid 3-0 lead, but then came the play of the week! With time ticking away, Selimah Tully of the Fire Eaters launched a cannonball from Center Field for a TWO-POINT SHOT! The crowd went berserk! But alas, the comeback fell just short. A tough loss for the Eponore-backed squad, but what a highlight to go home with!

---

And that's Week 3, you beautiful brutes! A week of overtime, pain, and for some of us, profound sorrow. But that's the beauty of this game! It builds character... usually by breaking a few bones first! Until next time, this is Nok the Corrupter, reminding you: if you're not bleeding, you're not trying! **GOODNIGHT, OSTERRA!** üòà
